be.belgium.eid.eidlib
Class BeID

java.lang.Object
  be.belgium.eid.eidlib.SmartCard
      be.belgium.eid.eidlib.BeID

public class BeID
extends SmartCard

The beID class is the main interface to perform operations on the Belgian eID card and to perform verification, sign documents, etc... . This interface should be used when trying to perform high-level operations in your own system. Every operation connects to the smart card if not yet connected before performing the operation itself. TODO Check SW's after every execution of transmitAPDU. Perhaps check the SW there and throw the exception

Version:
1.0.0 07 Dec 2007
Author:
Kristof Overdulve

Constructor Detail

BeID

public BeID(java.lang.String name,
            boolean enableTestCard)
Sets up the requirements needed for a valid functioning. The system connects to the smart card reader with the given name. The reader used is an open SC reader using the PC/SC protocol.

Parameters:
name - is the name of the smart card reader to connect with
enableTestCard - indicates whether test cards with invalid roots are enabled

BeID

public BeID(boolean enableTestCard)
Sets up the requirements needed for a valid functioning. The system connects to the first smart card reader that is found in the system and that works with the PC/SC driver.

Parameters:
enableTestCard - indicates whether test cards with invalid roots are enabled
Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
             throws EIDException
Connects the smart card to the system if possible. This operation should only be performed when calling a method of the class SmartCard. When calling a method of the BeID class itself, this method is implicitly executed. It does however not harm to perform this operation multiple times since nothing happens when already connected. Prefer to use this method to using the connect methods of the SmartCard class.

Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

getIDData

public IDData getIDData()
                 throws EIDException
Returns the ID information from the card currently inserted in the smart card reader. This data includes the personal information and some ID specific information.

Returns:
the ID information
Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

generateSignature

public byte[] generateSignature(byte[] data,
                                java.lang.String pinCode,
                                BeID.SignatureType sigType)
                         throws EIDException
Generates a signature for the given data. This signature is calculated on the SHA1 hash of the given data. The signature can later be verified by anyone to assure that the data sent was really yours.

Parameters:
data - is the data to generate a signature for. Although a byte array is not the most easy format to work with, it is the most versatile format. When the data to verify is just a string, perform String.getBytes() and pass the resulting byte array as argument
pinCode - is the PIN code of the card needed to provide secure signing
sigType - is the type of signature to use, either an authentication signature or a non repudiation signature
Returns:
the generated signature. This signature can later be saved to
Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

verifySignature

public boolean verifySignature(byte[] data,
                               byte[] signature,
                               BeID.SignatureType sigType)
                        throws EIDException
Verifies the signature by verifying the buffer against the signature, using the given public key and the algorithm SHA1withRSA.

Parameters:
data - is the data to verify
signature - is the signature to verify against the data
sigType - is the type of signature to verify
Returns:
whether the verification succeeded or not
Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

verifyOCSP

public boolean verifyOCSP(CertificateChain certChain)
                   throws EIDException
Verifies the certificates on the currently inserted eID card by sending a OCSP request to a certified OCSP responder whose host address is located on the eID certificates. The returning value indicates whether everything went fine. If everything went fine the status of all certificates is set to OK. If there is a revocation of some kind, false is returned and the revoked certificates have a status that contains the reason for failure.

Parameters:
certChain - is the certificate chain to verify, the status of the certificates in this chain are adjusted
Returns:
whether the verification succeeded or not
Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

verifyCRL

public boolean verifyCRL(CertificateChain certChain,
                         RNCertificate rnCert)
                  throws EIDException
Verifies the certificates on the currently inserted eID card by using certificate revocation lists (CRLs). The returning value indicates whether everything went fine. If everything went fine the status of all certificates is set to OK. If there is a revocation of some kind, false is returned and the revoked certificates have a status that contains the reason for failure.

Parameters:
certChain - is the certificate chain to verify, the status of the certificates in this chain are adjusted
rnCert - is the National Register certificate to verify, the status of this certificate is adjusted when performing this action.
Returns:
whether the verification succeeded or not
Throws:
EIDException - when the operation couldn't be performed successfully, the cause of the problem contains a more detailed description

enableCardListener

public void enableCardListener(CardListener cl)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Enables the prompting for the card being inserted or removed. This enables the user to plug in their own actions to execute when the card is inserted or removed.

Parameters:
cl - are the actions to occur when the card is inserted/removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the interval is negative

disableCardListener

public void disableCardListener()
Disables the prompting for the card being inserted or removed.

getCardListener

public CardListener getCardListener()
Returns the card listener. Returns null if the listening is not enabled.

Returns:
the card listener
